description: Whorled Milkweed (Asclepias verticillata) is an amazing plant species with special properties that make it stand out from other milkweeds. It is drought-tolerant, able to thrive in clay or rocky soils, and has a high content of medicinal compounds that have antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties. Its unique leaves form a tufted whorl around the stem, and its cheerful clusters of yellow-orange flowers are beloved by pollinators. This milkweed species is an important host-plant for the Monarch butterfly, making it a valuable addition to the garden. Its deep roots and tough stems add to its hardiness, making it an essential part of the garden.
